    • Method Detail

      • createMouseEventFromCurrentState

        public static CoreMouseEventLwjgl createMouseEventFromCurrentState(short mouseEventType)
        Creates a new CoreMouseEvent using the data collected from the last call to Mouse.poll(). It is the responsibility of the caller to call Mouse.next() to advance to the next buffered event.

        Mouse event type resolution requires information about the previous state of the mouse that is outside of the scope of this class. It may sometimes even be necessary to create more than one event from the data polled via the LWJGL Mouse class. It is the responsibility of the caller to determine the appropriate type for the event being created; this method will then pull the rest of the static event data from the Mouse's current event state.
        Parameters:
        mouseEventType - the type of the mouse event, as determined by the caller
        Returns:
        the CoreMouseEventLwjgl representing this event
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the Keyboard has not yet been initialized via Keyboard.create().

      • getClickCount

        public short getClickCount()
        Always returns 1 for LWJGL implementation. LWJGL then presumably registers two separate events in the queue for double/triple clicks.
        Specified by:
        getClickCount in interface CoreMouseEvent
